rename.to: fix TODO for VNode::apply for VNode::VRef variant

issue.title: Add support for SVG

repository.name: stdweb
repository.description: A standard library for the client-side Web

issue.body:
It would be great to add support for SVG so that we could render graphviz (among other things)

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG

This looks to be an absolutely _massive_ undertaking. There are like [50 SVG Elements](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element) alone and well over [200 SVG Attributes](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute) and about [100 SVG Interfaces](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/DOM/DOM_Reference#SVG_interfaces) (these numbers are just eyeballed).

I wonder -- is there some kind of shortcut we can take here for a (non-performant) MVP?

issue.title: Add SVG Support

repository.name: yew
repository.description: Rust / Wasm framework for creating reliable and efficient web applications

issue.body: Does yew support SVG dom nodes, or canvas drawing?

issue.title: Incomplete: fix #194 attempt to figure out how to set innerHTML

repository.name: yew
repository.description: Rust / Wasm framework for creating reliable and efficient web applications

issue.body:
this is to try and address #194 

Everything compiles but the output _still_ doesn't compile. I'm a bit at a loss at the moment. If anyone can see what I'm doing wrong I would appreciate it!

body: I think I'm missing something -- how are we communicating to javascript that our node is doing _anything_? I feel like the `apply` method is doing it with the `parent`...
This is related to  #189 and makes me at least convinced that it is non-trivial.

issue.title: add support to render VNode::VRef: render arbitrary HTML, including SVG!

repository.name: yew
repository.description: Rust / Wasm framework for creating reliable and efficient web applications

issue.body:
This is attempt number 2 for #195 

- fix #194 
- fix #189 

This is _essentially_ `innerHTML` -- allowing the user to inject _any_ `Element` that they have.
